meanings.definition: To have a tendency or inclination towards something.
meanings.sent1: I tend to eat too much candy when I'm stressed.
meanings.sent2: She tends to wake up early every morning.
meanings.sent3: My dog tends to steal socks and hide them in his bed.
meanings.sent4: The river tends to flow gently towards the sea.
meanings.sent5: The old clock tends to run fast on windy days.

meanings.definition: To care for or look after something.
meanings.sent1: I tend to my plants by watering them every day.
meanings.sent2: She tends to her little brother when he is sick.
meanings.sent3: The nurse tends to the patients with kindness and patience.
meanings.sent4: The farmer tends to his crops with great care.
meanings.sent5: The mother tends to her baby's needs throughout the night.

meanings.definition: To be disposed or inclined in a certain direction.
meanings.sent1: He tends towards being shy in social situations.
meanings.sent2: The cat tends towards sleeping in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent3: The car tends towards veering to the left if you don't hold the steering wheel tight.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts tend towards optimism even in difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The wind tends towards blowing from the east during this season.
